citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Male Samoyed (#1, microchip #0A0157221) is observed shaking his head multiple times. Closer inspection revealed the
skin deep inside the left ear canal is slightly reddened and the hair on the inside of both ear canals is coated in a wet
discharge. Additionally, both ear canals have clumps of a greasy-dark colored material inside them, and this material is
also trapped in the hair directly beneath the ears. The Veterinary Medical Officer examining the dog noticed a yeast-like
smell exuding from the ear. The dog had been treated for the condition of its ears between February 25th and February
29th but is not currently receiving any treatment.
Abnormal conditions of the ears could cause pain and discomfort to the dog and lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Female Bulldog (#363, microchip #725835) has an abnormal condition of the eyes. The whites of both eyes are severely
reddened, and a large amount of yellow colored discharge is covering both eyes and coating the hair surrounding each
eye. The dog was hesitant to hold its eyes open while being examined by the inspector. The facility had treated the dog’s
eyes between April 7th and April 12th and had planned to have the dog rechecked April 26th but the animal is not
currently receiving any treatment for the condition.
Abnormal conditions of the eyes could cause pain and discomfort to the dog and lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Female Bernese Mountain dog (#42, microchip #7E10334930) is observed by the inspectors to be sensitive on all four
feet while walking around the enclosure. Closer examination revealed the dog has areas of reddened, irritated, and
slightly swollen skin on the bottom of each foot. The majority of the irritated areas are located along the foot pads on
each foot. A few small areas of irritated skin are located around the toenails on the topside of the hindfeet. The condition
of the dog’s feet has not been noticed and the animal is currently receiving no treatment.
Abnormal skin conditions could cause pain and discomfort to the dog and could lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Female Cavalier spaniel (#69, microchip #7E10312712) has poor dental health and an abnormal condition of the eye. A
thick brownish-grey colored material is coating the majority of the surface of the upper canine teeth and front teeth. The
upper gums are slightly reddened and have receded away from the teeth. One upper incisor is loose and moved easily
when the inspector applied gentle pressure. The white of the dog’s left eye is moderately reddened and a small amount
of yellow colored discharge is attached to the hair near the corner of the eye. The condition of the dog’s teeth and eye
have not been noticed and the animal is currently receiving no treatment.
Poor dental health and abnormal conditions of the eye could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to
further health issues if left untreated.
Male Pomeranian (#3, microchip #64578, “Manny”) has poor dental health. The entire surface of the upper and lower
cheek teeth on both sides of the mouth are encased in a dark brown colored material and nearly the entire surface of the
upper and lower canine teeth are also covered in the brown material. A grey colored material is located along the gum
line of the upper right and left teeth. The gums are slightly reddened and have receded away from the teeth. One upper
right cheek tooth and one lower right cheek tooth are loose and moved easily when the inspector applied gentle pressure
to them. The condition of this dog’s teeth has not been noticed and the animal is not currently receiving any treatment.
Poor dental health could cause pain and discomfort to the animal as well as lead to further health issues if left untreated.
Female poodle (#17, microchip #591962) is observed scooting on her rump along the floor of the enclosure. Closer
examination of the animal revealed a large clump of dried and wet feces attached to the hair coat beneath her tail.
Numerous rope-like mats of hair are attached to the top of the dog’s head and beneath the right eye. The condition of the
dog’s hair coat has not been noticed but the facility representative stated to the inspectors that the dog could be groomed
that day.
Feces trapped in the hair coat could cause the animal discomfort as well as attract pests such as insects and allow for the
growth of disease-causing agents. Matted hair coats could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to further
health issues.
Female Bulldog (#355, microchip #1747566) has an abnormal condition of the eyes. The whites of both eyes are
severely reddened and both eyes appear cloudy. A yellow-colored discharge is coating the hair around both eyes and a
large amount of the discharge is located in the interior corner of the right eye. The dog had received treatment for the
eyes on April 4th but is not currently receiving any additional treatment.
Abnormal conditions of the eyes could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Female Bulldog (#54, microchip #7E10334924) has an abnormal condition of the right eye. The white of the eye is
severely reddened and the eye appears cloudy. A yellow discharge is located on the surface of the eye and trapped in
the hair surrounding the eye. The dog had received treatment for the eye between April 7th and April 12th but is not
currently receiving any treatment.
Abnormal conditions of the eye could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Female French bulldog (#3, microchip #263537) has excessively worn teeth. The majority of the cheek teeth on both
sides of the mouth have been worn down close to the gum line. All the canine teeth and front teeth have also had
approximately half their original length worn away and no longer have the normal pointed shape of the tooth. Several of
the teeth have possible exposed pulp cavities (the area of the nerve and vessels in the center of the tooth). A silver-
colored material is also adhered to the surface of at least three of the cheek teeth. The condition of the dog’s teeth has
not been noticed and the animal hasn't been evaluated for treatment.
Excessively worn teeth could cause conditions that are painful to the dog as well as lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Female Golden retriever (#3, microchip #7E10180572) has an abnormal condition of the ears and skin. A large area of
wet hair is located beneath the right ear and closer examination revealed the skin in this area appears moderately
reddened. The skin inside the left ear canal is slightly reddened and the hair is coated in a yellow-colored discharge. A
greasy-dark colored material is covering the skin inside the right ear canal and areas of this skin are slightly reddened.
The condition of this dog’s ears and skin has not been noticed and the animal is not currently receiving any treatment.
Abnormal conditions of the skin and ears could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to further health
issues if left untreated.
Female Bulldog (#5, microchip #525391) has an abnormal condition of the left eye. The eye appears cloudy and the
white of the eye is slightly reddened. Wet and dry discharge are also coating the hair surrounding the eye. The condition
of this dog’s eye has not been noticed and the animal is currently receiving no treatment.
Abnormal conditions of the eye could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Female Bulldog (#137) has an abnormal skin condition on both front feet. Areas of swellings are located between the
outside toes on both front feet. The areas are reddened have a small amount of discharge. The condition of the dog’s
skin has not been noticed and the animal’s condition isn’t under treatment.
Abnormal conditions of the skin could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Male Bulldog (#5, microchip #7E10334920) has an abnormal condition of the skin. A dried lesion is located on the dog’s
left hip which has broken open exposing the raw tissue beneath it. The exposed tissue is dark red and wet and the
remaining areas of the lesion are covered in a thick, dry, crust-like material. The condition of the dog’s skin has not been
noticed and the animal is currently not receiving treatment.
Abnormal conditions of the skin could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to further health issues if left
untreated.
Male Cavalier (#1, microchip #650891) has an abnormal condition of the skin of the left ear and poor dental health. A
lesion is located on the upper side of the left ear flap where it attaches to the head. The lesion is round and crusted and
when lightly touched a thick light-colored discharge (pus) came out from the center of the crusted area. The hair
surrounding the lesion is wet and also contains a dry flaky material. The dog’s upper left canine tooth has been worn
away to approximately half its original length and no longer has the normal pointed shape of the tooth but ends with a flat
surface. The condition of this dog’s ear and tooth has not been noticed and the animal is not currently receiving
treatment.
Abnormal conditions of the skin and excessively worn teeth could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to
further health issues if left untreated.
Each dealer shall use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee is
required to have the above-mentioned animals evaluated by a veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an
effective treatment plan. The licensee must ensure each animal receives adequate veterinary care at all times.
Male Pomesky (#5, microchip #53012) has a severely matted hair coat. The matted hair is located along the top of the
dog’s hips down to the base of the tail. The clumps of matted hair are thick and solid and held tightly against the skin and
the hair coat in the affected area is wet. The condition of the dog’s hair coat has not been noticed and no treatment
(grooming) has been provided or planned.
Matted hair coats could cause pain and discomfort to the dog as well as lead to further health issues if left untreated.
Each dealer shall use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee
must have the matted hair and/or fecal material removed from the hair coats of male Pomsky (#5) and female poodle
(#17). The licensee must ensure that the hair coat of each dog remains clean and free of matted hair at all times in order
to support the health and well-being of the animals.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The enclosures in the "Bulldog Building" are constructed with wood frames. The wood is covered with metal to protect it
from the dogs. In at least two enclosures, housing a total of three dogs, the metal pieces are coated in a thick buildup of
dirt, rust, and a dark brown greasy material. The inspector was able to use her fingernail to peel the rust and greasy
material off the metal. Buildup of dirt, rust and other materials could increase the risk of disease towards the animals.
Used primary enclosures and food and water receptacles for dogs and cats must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks
and more often if necessary to prevent an accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards.
The license must remove the materials that are coating the metal pieces and sanitize these surfaces. The licensee must
ensure that all aspects of the enclosures are maintained in a clean and sanitary manner in order to support the health of
the animals.
To be corrected by: 03-May-2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
SCOTT WELCH, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
HEATHER COLE n
